author: {'steamid': '76561198111029487', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 47, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1711555559}
review: Second worst ND title (behind Midnight in Salem).

author: {'steamid': '76561199204904904', 'num_games_owned': 6, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1040, 'last_played': 1708756786}
review: Absolutely love this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141087697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1490, 'last_played': 1602429209}
review: Not my favorite but fun to play! I love that it is set in Greece and adds a touch of Greek Mythology. I end is a little korny but I would recommend this game for Nancy Drew fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561199093723363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1705626127}
review: Probably my least favorite played in the Nancy Drew series. I didn't hate the puzzles, but how you progress in the game didn't feel logical, and there's just no great flow in how to move on and trigger the next phase of the game. Story line wasn't terrible, but just felt disjointed compared to many other games.

author: {'steamid': '76561199273125630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1704152730}
review: I love Nancy Drew games and have been playing them for a while, this one really disappointed me. I love Greek Mythology and theatre so I thought this game was going to be super fun. The characters were just okay and the mystery was just like too far fetched. Also the puzzles really felt like they had nothing to do with the plot, Overall its beautiful to look at and the mechanics are much better than the old games but the story line, characters and puzzles just make it not worth the time in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198384087061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1704325676}
review: knweL'Nevw'ljewJL'

author: {'steamid': '76561198160093679', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1679887922}
review:
This was not one of my favorite ND games. 
If you are playing through all of them I would recommend you get it on sale.

I was really looking forward to this game, it seemed interesting and the backgrounds look beautiful.
However, the story was predictable, I didn't like any of the characters, it got boring half way through and since I wasn't invested in the characters or story I wasn't that interested in finishing the game. The ending was good, some of the puzzles were good, but not many of them. I do not think I would play this one again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116854643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1701070068}
review: One of the more mature entries in the series. Played it with someone and it was certainly more enjoyable for that. Puzzles were a bit convoluted and really saturated the back half.

author: {'steamid': '76561199050222030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1700903243}
review: Played on Amateur: the puzzles are challenging, but not impossible, and the hint feature helps point you in the right direction before giving you spoilers. There's not too many locations/rooms available, and feels rather contained and less spacious than other ND games, but I did enjoy the story line and soundtrack! I love that the game is educational and informative as it is based in a museum of ancient Greek artifacts and mythological lore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121043592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1679260749}
review: That set must have cost about $30,000,000 to build, right? Who built it? Who paid for it and how? Where is the stage crew? Who decided this made sense? I can only suspend my disbelief but so much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198842062621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1689449186}
review: This one doesn't feel as logically thought through as some of the other games in the series (how on earth did this troupe get hired... and I'm still trying to figure out how those stages could have been feasible...), but it was a fun overview of Greek mythology, had great characters, and absolutely stunning sets. Very colorful and fun. Highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047606111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1693947795}
review: It had a really interesting story line but the puzzles were a lot harder than most of the other Nancy Drew games. I feel like their instructions or "hints" for solving puzzles weren't really that helpful and I was still completely confused about what I was supposed to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999171541', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1692513505}
review: UGH. try any other nancy drew title you'll enjoy it. not this one. so bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077093512', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1690662478}
review:
I'm playing my way through all of the ND games, and I suspect most people reading this review are too, regardless of reviews! But here are my thoughts anyway.

labyrinth of lies is definitely going in my top 3 ND titles of all time! I really enjoyed it, and it probably had one of my favorite settings of all the titles I've played (though i'm very excited for SOD!) the underworld set was just so cool, and for the most part i really enjoyed the puzzles. there were some unexpectedly tough ones towards the end, but it was really fun! i enjoyed the characters and the plot, and don't really have any major criticisms.

author: {'steamid': '76561199110264153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1690223577}
review: They really put a lot of effort into this dialogue! I'm really enjoying going back and playing these games as an adult.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021845784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1692758903}
review: Epic gameplay and plot, just like all the ND games from HerInteractive! Love the graphics for this game also, and all the vivid locations! I also find ancient Greece and Rome fascinating. highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198301142222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1687993893}
review: Has a lot of challenging puzzles and a pretty good twist to the plot line.

author: {'steamid': '76561199488377408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1686690073}
review: I love Nancy Drew - I love the old games, I love many of the new games, I love the camp and quirks that come along with game play. That said, this game did not work for me. Between the issues with navigation (at no point in the game can you take a 360 view of the setting), the plot holes, the issues with game mechanics (the NPC appearing in two locations at the same time in different costumes and different moods; talking to people twice in a row and receiving materially different updates; uh....what is Kronos?), this was a bummer for me. What makes it worse is that the story line and dialogue almost (almost!) could have redeemed this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198929993340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1685424997}
review: All Nancy Drew games are amazing. Nothing negative to say at all. I 11/10 recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561199071429917', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1694738004}
review: Learn about Greek mythology and explore theatrical sets based on the Greek Underworld!

author: {'steamid': '76561198825506665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1554, 'last_played': 1652546022}
review:
nancy drew + greek mythology=perfection 

dont listen to the haters, this game def has its issues but i still really enjoyed it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995330076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1618012527}
review: I think this might actually be the worst Nancy Drew game?

author: {'steamid': '76561199228716368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1680460278}
review: Might be one of the top 3 ND games I have played. Puzzles were challenging, but not extremely difficult. I really enjoyed the Ancient Greece aspect and learning more about the gods and thought the puzzles were very intuitive when it came to researching and applying the knowledge. The art style of the underworld was absolutely mesmerizing to wander through and I enjoyed this game from start to finish. Highly recommend!!

author: {'steamid': '76561199276602586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1678305942}
review: the disk puzzle got on my nerves other than that great plot, great puzzles,

author: {'steamid': '76561199034186623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1677713610}
review: Setting is great (the underground is amazing), characters have character, plot is good. But you do have to run a mile to get from one character to the next. Didn't like it as much as I wanted to.

author: {'steamid': '76561199172968485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1686899442}
review: Its very enjoyable

author: {'steamid': '76561198047418416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1674874033}
review: This was probably my least favourite of the nancy drew games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033421059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1690947086}
review: Lots of fun, heavy on greek mythology. Game location is fantastic and they really outdid themselves on graphics. A very fun mystery game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199058090930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1668488278}
review: I love all Nancy Drew games. Sometimes a little difficult...but hints help.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096041343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1664296431}
review: I played this game growing up so I wanted to replay it now. I love the Greek mythology spin on it and I feel like Nancy isn't in much danger compared to some of her other games. Some of the puzzle are kinda tricky in Master mode because there isn't much instructions given and they are usually written in riddles. Overall, I enjoyed this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198865768308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1663912389}
review: Fun game so far, even though I've yet to finish it. I have several ND games, but I've only finished one of them (Alibi in Ashes). I've had to use a guide for most of the puzzles, but otherwise it's been a blast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053451908', 'num_games_owned': 1148, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1658050159}
review: Continues to remain one of the only game series my wife will play with me - and i grudgingly enjoy them despite terrible pacing, hammy characters and awkwardly confusing puzzles, there's still something fun there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329732394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1656386846}
review: I really enjoy all the nancy drew games

author: {'steamid': '76561198088243363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1650488061}
review: I'm sorry, I rarely review negatively because I don't want people to be turned off by something that they might like. However, if you are already reading this, I must say, out of the many Nancy Drew games you can play, you can definitely skip this one, and it won't affect your enjoyment of the other better games whatsoever. This has one of the weirdest plots of the whole series, not to mention the many gaping plot holes in it. Puzzles are ok, none of them really stood out as amazing, but none were like terribly bad or annoying to play. There were some obtuse thinking in this one, just because I think whoever designed them overthought how complicated they wanted things to be. so yeah, skip this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062381154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1607642425}
review: Game is terrible. I like nancy drew games but this game should be overwhelmingly negative.

author: {'steamid': '76561199143374827', 'num_games_owned': 22, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1648947087}
review: perfect game for everyone to enjoy. Choppy story line if you dont follow the right way, but I love an interesting Nancy Drew game and when I first ordered it, it was fun and took a minute to solve puzzles. My husband can solve them in a flash so now we play together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198891092929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1648714782}
review: stan nancy drew

author: {'steamid': '76561198454578195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1646888627}
review: Yeah, the reviews don't lie. This is not a good one. It wasn't obvious. Hard to believe that each of the performers is starting to act like their characters (in the play), and then they have this basement hideout (that is so so so cool and well done). Are we supposed to believe that it is just for them and not for some museum or interactive area for the public? It would be like if that whole temple in The Scarlet Hand were made just for the staff to hang out it?! Doesn't make sense. Also, these puzzles were all over the place and didn't feel like they were naturally in the environment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163750444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1646572562}
review:
Definitely in the lowest 3 Nancy Drew games for me and I’ve played all 33 games (up to Midnight in Salem). 

I do enjoy the fact that it wasn’t a spooky setting for once so it’s a more “chill” game. I do also love the underworld set, I think it was nicely done.

However those are probably the only 2 things I actually liked about the game. First of all, I find that I do not care for any of the characters at all. *minor spoiler ahead* Like somehow even a certain character being all mysterious and sketchy about his past doesn’t actually make me curious? 

Secondly, I feel like the game doesn’t flow nicely. Like the sequence of events doesn’t really make sense and I found myself stuck a couple of times.

Overall not an enjoyable Nancy Drew game, it’s not exciting and when I was 70% through, all I could think of is getting it over with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282745247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1645467362}
review: I really enjoyed all the puzzles in this Nancy Drew game! The dialogue was short, sweet, and to-the-point, with the main emphasis being on puzzles to progress the game. This is just the way I like it! Uncovering new locations also made the game more invigorating. I really enjoyed re-visiting this game again! PS: Make sure you take notes on some of the Greek lore you find if you're playing on Master Sleuth, it may come in handy for puzzles later when pieces of your inventory are no longer there!

author: {'steamid': '76561199068762356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1643152280}
review: One of the best Nancy Drew games I've played. Good diversity and quantity of puzzles, some other games there are fewer puzzles. A good balance between the challenge of figuring out what you need to do next / how to solve a puzzle, and the clues that help you figure it out. In some other games it's sometimes too easy or too hard. Characters with interesting back stories, good pacing with the plot, and love the setting. Liked how the whodunnit format is different in this game than in other games.

author: {'steamid': '76561199037858775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3491, 'last_played': 1643832504}
review: My only aggravation with this game was the lack of instruction through it. Thank god for a check list. Also the puzzles were incredibly difficult even on amateur level

author: {'steamid': '76561198117107617', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1642872153}
review: I liked this ND game, but definitely not my favorite. I liked how different it felt by being in Greece, but I feel like the mystery part of the game doesn't come in till pretty late. I also thought that some of the puzzles were kind of advanced (even in amateur detective mode). But overall I thought the story line was good. Although looking back I do regret buying it full price ($19.99).

author: {'steamid': '76561199112406377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1704005816}
review: I wasnt sure about this one at first after playing the Shattered Medallion, but I'm really glad I played it. The recent Nancy Drew games, this one and Sea of Darkness, were beautifully made. The voices, graphics, story lines, theyre so good! I was really excited for Midnight in Salem and had a hard time getting into it. I REALLLLLY hope they make some more like Sea of Darkness and Labyrinth of Lies. I've been playing Nancy Drew since I was young and I love these games so much. I really want to keep playing them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198855346696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1641020931}
review: Good story, nothing amazing, but definitely good. If you don't like a lot of big, complicated puzzles like RAN,  but don't like MID for it's lack of hard puzzles, this game is a good compromise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198448340576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1641079877}
review: It was informative and unpredictable. Mystery++

author: {'steamid': '76561198224789652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1640331556}
review: Lots of puzzles! Not always seamless to the story (which is good), but lots of good, varying difficulty puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102310869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1636527914}
review: I LOVE Greek myths so I was really excited for this game but it was honestly one of my least favorite ND games to date. The story was predictable and also really ran in circles several times, the flow of the game was very un-intuitive to me and some of the puzzles were ridiculous. There were also plot holes that I don't usually find in ND games such as an NPC being in literally two places at once in different outfits and in one place they're mad at you and one they're not, enough that I started expecting a Waverly Academy-esk twist that didn't come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198993944032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1611806383}
review:
This game was...okay. I loved playing the old Nancy Drew games, when I was a kid, even though they terrified me to no end. I picked up this one to try out since its one I'd never played before, and as a Classical Studies major I was excited for a Greek-myth themed game. 
It definitely feels like the Nancy Drew games I remember, though I did find the plot a little bit lacking. Nevertheless I did really enjoy revisiting the series and I'd definitely try out more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023280350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1644638743}
review: 9/10 - Great setting, good puzzles, and a cast of characters you will never forget. Shout out to Grigor for his excellent writing skills!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024521887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1622197851}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018841545', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1623597484}
review: a lot of puzzles. not good mix pf puzzle and investigation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198803442380', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1624401310}
review: As a lover of Greek mythology and Nancy Drew, this game was a huge hit! I will definitely be adding this to my favorites!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071052901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1613532921}
review: This one has everything I want in a Nancy Drew game. The puzzles are decent, the set (although limited) looks really cool, it's educational, and the characters are well written. I really like the characters in this one; they are dynamic and the voice actors did a great job. There are a few hinky moments trying to get events to trigger but besides that I found the plot engaging. I think this is one of my favourite Nancy Drew games.

author: {'steamid': '76561199072210207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1259, 'last_played': 1655589231}
review: Love it! They layered the plot very well. I like all the characters, and exploring was a lot of fun in this game! I am also a sucker for Greek mythology, so that may be why I like it so much, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121922841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 802, 'last_played': 1611427907}
review: not bad

author: {'steamid': '76561198111184148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1209, 'last_played': 1594248378}
review: I thought this was really fun and it had plenty of different "locations" to explore. For people who enjoy mythology, it was fun to see their interpretation of the stories as well! I will say, it didn't necessarily end on a high note, but the playthrough was good enough I'll give it a pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045613674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1609723102}
review:
I really enjoyed this one.

The plot made sense, the puzzles involved research but weren't overly difficult and the characters were interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129094235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1610514412}
review:
This morning I was fired from my job after 25 years of working there. My boss had retired and let this POS college grad with $200,000 in student debt and an ego the size of Texas take over, firing everyone over the age of 35 in order to "progress the company into the next century." F*CK YOU, CHAD! F*CK YOU AND YOUR PORSCHE YOUR DAD BOUGHT YOU! Have fun looking for the huge sh*t I took in your wiper fluid container!!!

TlDr Nancy Drew 8/10 Would recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561199089526805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1608970796}
review: I would recommend if you could find this on sale. I have to agree with some of the users that the pacing was a little slow. There were one or two puzzles that were a little too hard in my opinion, but overall a decent game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198187022739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1702029883}
review: This one was very middle of the road for me, I liked the more chill setting (after playing lots of ND games with a spooky vibe it's nice to have a change) and the overall atmosphere and style of the game. But there are a lot of annoying slider puzzles in this (my least favorite kind) and you do end up doing a lot of chores that don't really have anything to do with the main objective of the game. The story itself was fine but again, nothing too special and I didn't feel like I connected really with any of the characters. Overall, just kind of *meh*.

author: {'steamid': '76561198412037538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1198, 'last_played': 1672637196}
review: This is one of my favorite Nancy Drew games. It has wonderful puzzles, memorable characters, and a cool twist. I have replayed this game several times through and have enjoyed myself every time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339529905', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1601437261}
review: I enjoyed this one a lot, honestly. Especially when compared to The Shattered Medallion. My only real complaints are that the names are a little... obnoxiously on the nose (Thanos and Kronos and Niobe and Xenia...) and Thanos overall was absent most of the game and easily hated the rest. The actual end result of the mystery was pretty predictable. I did enjoy it, though, so I won't complain too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006903775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2658, 'last_played': 1593735735}
review:
it’s okay! i probably would’ve given it a thumbs down if i’d played it before midnight in salem, but it’s definitely better than midnight in salem.

my main complaint is the pacing and the amount of spoon-feeding. there are a lot of nd games where you are sort of led gently through the story, but this one feels less like you’re driving it and more like it’s being told to you with puzzles. most of the major breakthroughs don’t feel like things that you did yourself, but that might just be me. that being said, the sets are pretty, if a little immersion-breaking. the characters vary in quality imo.

i wouldn’t say skip it (especially if you’re doing an nd marathon) but definitely play other nd games too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025105407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1590690193}
review: It was okay. The story sort of all comes up together at the end instead of playing out smoothly but thats pretty normal for ND games lol. The puzzles were okay but to be honest most of them were pretty boring and, in my opinion, most of them didn't go with the them of the story. Also navigation is pretty confusing like I completely missed a pathway until I looked it up because I was stuck :/ The characters are good and I think that they were well thought out and the music is pretty good :) I have to say I didn't really like the voice acting in this game :/ People talk SO SLOW so I ended up just skipping through most of it or turning off my sound and reading it then skipping :/ Also the hints in the taskbar aren't helpful at ALL :( I got stuck quite a lot because there is so much stuff you need to do and the hints were always super vague :( But overall the games ok but not the best :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198355855125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1123, 'last_played': 1590187333}

author: {'steamid': '76561198272069011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1577909413}
review: Eh. I got this game for like $3.99 so I can't really complain. I've been playing ND games since 2002 and I've loved all of them up until the newer ones. This one is probably my least favorite out of that bunch. I didn't really feel like I was paying a mystery game. It felt like a museum curator chore simulator. When you finally get down to the set of the theater, it just gets really confusing. As other reviewers have stated, the backgrounds are well done, but that's definitely not enough reason to spend $20 on the game. I would only recommend getting this game if you want to play every game in the series, otherwise, skip it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198355314121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1530158146}
review:
While I'd be more likely to classify this game as neutral than bad, I would never recommend it. I've played 21 Nancy Drew games and this one was easily one of the worst I've played. There are so many better ones that unless you want to beat all of them, I can't say this one is worth your money or time. I'm a HUGE fan of Nancy Drew games, Greek history, and theatre. Given how much I enjoyed Secret of the Scarlet Hand (one of my favourites) and Tomb of the Lost Queen, I expected to love this game, but I found it very disappointing. 

For most of the game, the pacing is incredibly slow. This seems to be a result of two things. First of all, much of the story could be characterized as you waiting for the curator to get back so you take care of some small jobs and babysit some suspicious actors in the meantime. Something went wrong with a shipment and some artifacts went missing. The curator goes to investigate. Sounds exciting right? Too bad you're stuck at the museum. It's not even a suspenseful wait. The story is pretty predictable. The other factor is that many tasks you complete are accomplished by triggering things that don't really have a logical connection. Here's a pretty early example that I will make as spoiler-free as possible: the curator has left Nancy a list of tasks some of which involve using the computer. The computer is password protected, but Nancy is not able to call and ask for the password (which she will do later in the game to access a specific program). After some searching it's pretty easy to predict where to find the password, but you'll need another item to get it. Getting that item requires you to do something that has no logical connection to it. It's pretty frustrating when you're aimlessly wandering around this often and this early in the game, waiting for things to happen. 

Another thing that really bothered me about this game, was that you really NEED to make backup files because you can get stuck to the point you'll need to restart. I don't think this has been possible since the second game in the series which was released in 1999. To put the situation in as vague terms as possible, Nancy goes through a door and down a hallway. At one end of the hallway is a timed puzzle that if you fail results in a game over. However, you will not be able to to attempt the puzzle unless you have the required item. If you try and go back out the way you came, you'll find there's another puzzle on the back of the door you entered from. This puzzle requires a different item and you will not be able to attempt it unless you have it. Thus if you enter the hallway without one of those two items, you will not be able to leave the hallway. Unless you made a backup at an earlier point, you will have to restart. It's also worth noting that this inability to attempt puzzles you don’t have the items for can also be frustrating if you already have some knowledge of ancient Greece. You may be able to solve some based on your pre-existing knowledge, but will not be able to attempt them, until Nancy reads the book required for that puzzle.

One last annoyance I would like to add is that the characters keep talking about something world-specific and no one ever really explains what it is. It's possible that I might have picked some dialogue options out of order and missed that conversation though.

There are of course some good things in the game. The backgrounds look gorgeous. Although I wish they had put the same effort into Grigor's face (light haired man from the pictures in the steam store). It's a shame since he has some pretty entertaining dialogue, but I've played many games with worse faces so it's fine. The end of the game is easily the best part.  Things finally start to get exciting and the pace picks up. The epilogue is pretty comprehensive. This is something I really appreciated as it was a real weak point for Secret of the Scarlet Hand and The Tomb of the Lost Queen. I still had a couple of questions remaining, but this was one of the better epilogues in the series.

The sad thing is that the quality of the epilogue doesn't matter while my disinterest in my remaining questions are telling. The majority of the game is so dull, slow and frustrating it's difficult to get invested in the story or the ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103347134', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1500237936}
review: One of my personal favorites of the new Nancy Drews. She really brings out a cool aspect to ancient greece. Its fun and can be terrifying as well. Really a great game! Best of the point and clicks of herintereactive that I'ved played in recent time. If you enjoy an empowered woman being the hero and being able to solve the case than you'll certainly enjoy this one.
